p: Since monocyte/macrophage cell populations have been implicated in the amplification and dissemination of WNV in avian infections[ 35, 36], mutants were compared in cultured avian monocytes (HD11 cells) ( Fig 2B). The NYS/NYT viruses demonstrated statistically indistinguishable growth while the NYF mutant exhibited a 7-fold lower viral titer (p<0.05) at the earliest time point (0.5 dpi) and the mean peak titer was 3-fold lower than that of NYS. The KYS mutant demonstrated the most restricted phenotype with a 16-fold lower mean peak viral titer compared to NYS virus (p<0.05). In contrast, the non-glycosylated NYP/SYS mutants generated higher mean viral titers 6.3 and 6.8 log 10 PFU/mL, respectively compared to 5.6 log 10 PFU/mL at 1 dpi; however, the mean peak titers at 3 dpi were indistinguishable to that of NYS.
